original_title: Opry Video Classics: Hall of Fame 2
overview: Only artists who are the cream of the crop make the grade for the Country Music Hall of Fame, which was founded in 1961. Jim Reeves, the earliest inductee (1967) on Hall of Fame 2, delivers his chart-topper Billy Bayou. Johnny Cash, Hank Thompson, Loretta Lynn and George Jones add to the stellar cast. The class of 2001 boasted the Louvin Brothers, Waylon Jennings and two singer-songwriters, Bill Anderson and Don Gibson. Not bad for one year.
title: Opry Video Classics: Hall of Fame 2
